intro: Spermacoce remota, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species, many of which are known for their ornamental value. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a star-like appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. The plant is often cultivated for its delicate beauty and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
